message: "We want to give a message of hope, that you can be saved and there are people you can turn to." Dozens of airport employees underwent training last year from Airline Ambassadors, a nonprofit group in Arlington, Virginia, that educates the airline industry on how to recognize human trafficking and when to step in.

data.description: Airport and airline workers have attended classes over the past year to spot the signs of human trafficking as a way to prevent men, women and children from being shuffled out of Las Vegas against …
data.title: Las Vegas airport, airline workers learn to spot human trafficking
